@graph.name: OSHA Compliance Kits Tailored for California, New York, and Strict States

itemListElement.name: ComplianceSigns OSHA State Kit – California
itemListElement.description: A comprehensive safety kit tailored for California OSHA standards, with Cal/OSHA-specific signage, SDS binders, and IIPP documentation templates.

itemListElement.name: NY Safety First OSHA Kit
itemListElement.description: Designed for New York employers, this kit includes state-mandated labor law posters, bilingual safety instructions, and PPE essentials.

itemListElement.name: Nationwide OSHA Plus Kit
itemListElement.description: A multi-state OSHA kit that checks the boxes for tough regulators in CA, NY, WA, and more with inclusive gear and forms.

itemListElement.name: J.J. Keller California IIPP Kit
itemListElement.description: Built specifically for Cal/OSHA’s Injury and Illness Prevention Program (IIPP), this kit simplifies compliance with templates and guides.

itemListElement.name: SafeWork State-Specific OSHA Kit Bundle
itemListElement.description: Bundle OSHA kits for CA, NY, and WA into one set—regionally customized with posters, training tools, and first aid basics.

mainEntity.name: Do California and New York have different OSHA rules than federal standards?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes — states like California and New York operate their own OSHA-approved plans with stricter rules and reporting requirements than the federal OSHA baseline.

mainEntity.name: What should an OSHA kit for California include?

acceptedAnswer.text: A California-specific OSHA kit should include Cal/OSHA-compliant signage, an Injury and Illness Prevention Program (IIPP), safety data sheets, and appropriate first aid supplies.

mainEntity.name: Can I use one kit for multiple states?

acceptedAnswer.text: Only if the kit is multi-state certified. Otherwise, it's best to get kits tailored to each state’s unique OSHA plan to avoid fines or violations.
